message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering two vectors from phaseless Fourier measurements of their circular convolution, which involves signal processing, optimization, and machine learning techniques. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.SP (Signal Processing), and cs.MM (Multimedia) are all possible sub-categories that this paper could belong to. However, given that the paper focuses on the development of a novel convex relaxation method for the problem, cs.IT and cs.SP are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also provides an ADMM implementation and numerical experiments, which could make cs.MM a possible sub-category as well. Finally, the use of Rademacher complexity estimates suggests that cs.LG could also be a relevant sub-category.
